description: Smallest k>1 such that k divides sigma(k*n).
comments: a(n) = 2, 3 or 6. For any m, a(A028983(m)) = 2. If a(m)=6 then m is a square but if m is a square a(m) is not necessary 6, first example is 7: a(7^2)=3 (Cf. A072864).
links: R. J. Mathar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
maple: A049605 := proc(n)    for k from 2 do        if modp(numtheory[sigma](k*n),k) = 0 then            return k;        end if;    end do:end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 26 2015
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {k = 2; while(sigma(k*n) % k, k++); k ;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 21 2013
author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Jul 26 2002
